alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 10 at 4:27AM PST until January 13 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 30 to 35 feet. * WHERE...All beaches and shorelines of southern Oregon. The most extreme conditions are expected at and north of Cape Blanco. * WHEN...From 10 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Extremely large breaking waves will create very hazardous conditions along beaches and area shorelines. Waves will inundate beaches and surge into normally dry areas. Infrastructure damage and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf will begin to build early Thursday. The higher surf will spread to all areas of the coast Thursday evening and persist into early Friday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Beaches and coastlines will become hazardous due to very large and life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of beaches, rocks, jetties,piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
